image.altText: Close up of Qantas chief executive Alan Joyce speaking to the media at a press event.

items.synopsis: Qantas has confirmed it will refund $570 million worth of COVID travel credits for domestic and international customers, while the ACCC has accused the airline of selling tickets for flights it had already cancelled.

title.children: 'People lost faith in the process': Qantas scraps expiry dates on $570m worth of COVID travel credits

image.altText: A large ladder reaches at the top of the building with a firefighter in front of it

items.synopsis: One of the deadliest South African fires leads to at least 73 deaths and scores of injuries, according to emergency services.

title.children: 'Sad day for the city of Johannesburg': More than 70 dead in building blaze

image.altText: military vehicles are queued in a row with palm trees behind them

items.synopsis: Seven soldiers from the Australian Army and the Timor Leste Defence Force were taken to Royal Darwin Hospital for treatment following the crash, with three still there as of this evening.

title.children: ADF Bushmaster rolls near Darwin, injuring Australian, East Timorese troops

image.altText: A young and and older man both smile at the camera. They are both wearing sunglasses

items.synopsis: The father of 21-year-old Corporal Spencer Collart says his son, who was the Osprey's crew chief, put the lives of others before his own in a crash that killed three US marines.

title.children: Father of US marine killed in Osprey crash says his son 'died a hero'

image.altText: Woman in purple being handcuffed

items.synopsis: These "custodial killers" are often healthcare workers who murder helpless or dependent people in their care, writes Xanthe Mallett.

title.children: Why serial killers like Lucy Letby often work in healthcare

image.altText: An aerial image shows a volcanic island emitting white smoke surrounded by clear blue sea on a clear day.

items.synopsis: James, Andrew and Peter Buttle apply to have the charges they are facing over the deadly 2019 eruption of their volcano dismissed.

title.children: Brothers who inherited NZ volcano ask judge to drop charges, claiming 'this is not a prosecution of a family'

image.altText: Walter Sofronoff speaks to media.

items.synopsis: The chair of the inquiry into the prosecution of Bruce Lehrmann releases his correspondence with the ACT government by way of denying he breached the law when he provided copies of the report to two journalists before it was released by the ACT government.

title.children: Inquiry head denies breaking law by leaking report into Bruce Lehrmann's prosecution to media

image.altText: Don and Gail, dressed in warm jackets, smile as they stand in front of the sea on a sunny day.

items.synopsis: The town of Korumburra in Victoria's south-east has come together to celebrate the life of Don and Gail Patterson, who police believe died from mushroom poisoning at a family lunch in July.

title.children: 'Lots of love to you all': Suspected mushroom poisoning victim's text to family revealed at memorial service

image.altText: A semi-trailer and a wrecked car covered with a tarpaulin on the side of a country road.

items.synopsis: Police say a B-double truck travelling north on the Hume collided with a car that was turning onto the freeway, killing all four people inside. The truck driver, 30, was taken to hospital with non life-threatening injuries.

title.children: Police investigate after four killed in truck, car collision in north-east Victoria

image.altText: A composite image showing rock singer Jimmy Barnes, politician Clive Palmer and rapper Eminem.

items.synopsis: Rapper Eminem this week demanded Republican presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy stop playing Lose Yourself on the campaign trail. Here are 10 other instances politicians have gotten the cold shoulder from artists they admired.

title.children: 'Moronic charade of a campaign': Ten times musicians told politicians to quit playing their music

image.altText: A composite image of Richard Fejo and Helen Secretary side-by-side.

items.synopsis: The Northern Territory has been at the forefront of Australia's Aboriginal land rights movement for decades. But not everyone is sure the Voice will bring positive outcomes.

title.children: 'Backs against the wall': NT Aboriginal leaders speak out ahead of Voice referendum

image.altText: An drilling machine on a lake, blue sky with clouds, a drill in themiddle and two small boats on the side.

items.synopsis: A review of Gold Fields, which runs four mines in Australia,  has found that 47 per cent of its global workforce had experienced some form of inappropriate behaviour at work.

title.children: Global gold giant apologises for 'distressing' findings of widespread sexual harassment and bullying

image.altText: A man with a moustache in front of a party tent.

items.synopsis: The Queensland Supreme Court heard Ryan Bayldon-Lumsden lived at home in what was a "dysfunctional, toxic relationship".

title.children: Gold Coast councillor charged with murdering his stepfather released on bail after urgent hearing

image.altText: Anthony Albanese with his hands up.

items.synopsis: With South Australia and Tasmania considered the key states in contest in the Voice to Parliament referendum, the prime minister hits Hobart after his visit to SA yesterday to announce the date of the referendum.

title.children: 'Convinced Tasmanians will vote Yes': Albanese spruiks Voice in Hobart on first full campaign day

image.altText: Gloved hands hold a selection of vapes above a bin of multi-coloured objects.

items.synopsis: A state school on Queensland's Gold Coast turns away from its hardline stance on vaping, in favour of an educational approach that's now being shared with other schools.

title.children: This school abandoned automatic suspensions for vaping. Here's what happened

items.synopsis: Born out of anti-government rallies during the pandemic, authorities say Germany's Reichsbürger movement is a growing threat. And it's forging ties with one of the country's biggest political parties.

title.children: Peter Fitzek says Germany doesn't exist. So he declared himself the king of a new 'kingdom'

image.altText: Jim Chalmers speaks at a press conference

items.synopsis: Qantas updates its controversial travel credits scheme, as the ACCC launches legal action against the airline for allegedly selling tickets for flights it had already cancelled. Look back on the day's business and finance news as it happened with our blog.

title.children: ASX edges slightly higher, treasurer says allegations Qantas sold tickets for cancelled flights 'deeply concerning — as it happened

image.altText: edible seaweed being held up.

items.synopsis: Could South Goulburn Island become home to Australia's first sea grape farm? The Yagbani Aboriginal Corporation believes it can, bringing the celebrated ingredient known as umibudo in Japan to the plate.

title.children: Plan to farm sea grapes that pop in your mouth 'like caviar' off Arnhem Land

image.altText: An aerial photo of the snowy mountain hydro-electric complex at dusk.

items.synopsis: The government reveals planned expansions to the Snowy Hydro have suffered an incredible $10 billion blowout over price estimates given by former prime minister Malcolm Turnbull six years ago.

title.children: Snowy Hydro expansion hits reset button as costs blow out to $12 billion

image.altText: A woman wearing a purple hoodie with her hair tied back walking with three other women

items.synopsis: A mother of six who fatally stabbed her partner in the thigh had endured violence in a "seriously dangerous" relationship that was "going to end in tragedy", a court has heard.

title.children: Relationship 'plagued by alcohol abuse, violence' ends in mum stabbing partner to death

image.altText: A food delivery rider on a bicycle with a crowd of people in the distance.

items.synopsis: The workplace minister says a small increase to the cost of pizza deliveries is "a small price to pay" to ensure gig workers are safe, as the government unveils its plan for minimum rates of pay for workers earning income through apps such as Uber and DoorDash.

title.children: New minimum pay rates for gig workers worth 'small increase' to pizza prices, says minister

image.altText: Family and supporters wearing black t-shirts depicting Jomen as an angel

items.synopsis: Coroner Philip Urquhart finds prison staff knew about Mr Blanket's "suicide plan" eight weeks before he died and should have acted differently.

title.children: 'Chronic shortage' of safe cells enabled Indigenous man to take his own life in WA prison, coroner finds

image.altText: meat in a shop

items.synopsis: Prices paid to farmers for their lamb have fallen dramatically and shoppers should see prices decrease soon, according to the WA meat industry.

title.children: Cheaper meat on the horizon, but alarm for farmers as prices slump

image.altText: An orange moon appears behind a tower.

items.synopsis: Here are some photographs of the "blue" supermoon from around the world.

title.children: In pictures: Rare 'blue' supermoon brightens up night sky around the world

image.altText: A view of the Liddell coal-fired power plant from across a lake, with swans in the foreground

items.synopsis: Much of the national power grid is facing substantial reliability problems over the next decade, and as soon as this summer, without rapid investment in both electricity generation and transmission.

title.children: 'Imminent and urgent investment' required as national energy grid faces reliability fears ahead of hot summer

items.synopsis: The Colombian designer, whose bags have been seen with celebrity stars or on catwalks across the globe, has been extradited to the US for allegedly smuggling over 200 caiman- and python-skin products.

title.children: Luxury handbag designer Nancy Gonzalez extradited to US over illegal animal leathers

image.altText: A Hwasong-18 intercontinental ballistic missile is launched into the air as part of a North Korea's test launch

items.synopsis: South Korea and the United States were close to completing 11 days of military drills when the simulated strike occurred.

title.children: North Korea launches simulated nuclear strike as South and US wrap up military drills

image.altText: A woman leans against a tree with a Redfern sign behind her.

items.synopsis: While Yes voters in Redfern are hoping against heartache, the No campaign is targeting the undecided in Western Sydney.

title.children: How 'the Black capital of Australia' will be voting in the Voice referendum

image.altText: Anthony Albanese standing in front of "VOTE YES" branding as he announces the date of the Voice to Parliament referendum

items.synopsis: Whichever way the referendum goes, there will be enormous ramifications for reconciliation and Indigenous advancement. There will be political consequences felt all the way to the next election — and the next six weeks absolutely matter, writes David Speers.

title.children: The differences between a referendum and an election help explain why the Voice's Yes camp is so confident

image.altText: Picture of someone demonstrating spithood use.

items.synopsis: A report from the Northern Territory Ombudsman has recommended a ban on spit hoods in police custody — currently in place for children — be extended to adults.

title.children: NT Ombudsman recommends legislative ban on spit hoods in police custody

image.altText: An AFL player wearing a blazer smiles as he stands on stage alongside teammates during a presentation.

items.synopsis: For many years, GWS star Toby Greene played the role of the villain — now he is the skipper of the All-Australian Team. Andrew McGarry looks at his career arc, and the steps taken on the way to Greene's big honour.

title.children: From villain to captain — Toby Greene's career arc from AFL bad boy to All-Australian skipper

image.altText: People marching through a street carrying green, yellow, and blue flags

items.synopsis: Several nations have condemned a military junta in oil-rich Gabon as residents celebrate the end of a family dynasty.

title.children: 'Unconstitutional' Gabon coup draws widespread international condemnation

image.altText: A beekeeper and a woman in a tshirt scoop bees off the front of a car.

items.synopsis: A truck carrying five million bees crashes on a roadway in Ontario, Canada.

title.children: Canadian drivers urged to close car windows after millions of bees escape from truck

image.altText: A woman with brown hair holding a drink.

items.synopsis: Human remains which were found beside a busy highway in Goulburn have been identified as a Sydney woman who was murdered by her former boyfriend.

title.children: Human remains found by busy highway confirmed to be those of murdered Sydney woman

image.altText: An elephant reaches its trunk up to a container of fruit hanging from a tree. Its mouth is open

items.synopsis: A plan to bring three elephants to a South Australian zoo is now underway after donations reached more than $2 million in less than a month.

title.children: Elephant to catch 'jumbo jet' to South Australia after fundraising campaign realised
